chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak>
    Preface<break time="500ms"/>
<s>TO THE BISHOPS OF THE KINGDOM OF LOTHAR.</s>
<break time="1s"/>
</speak>

<speak>
<s>Gunthar and Theotgaud, to our holy and venerable brothers and fellow bishops, greetings in the Lord.</s>
<s>We humbly ask you, our beloved brothers, to continually offer us the solace of your holy prayers, as we constantly pray for you.</s>
<s>Do not be disturbed or frightened by the rumors that might be spreading about us and you.</s>
<s>We trust in the most merciful goodness of our Lord that, with God's help, neither the plots of our enemies nor those against our king will succeed, nor will our adversaries rejoice over us.</s>
<s>Although Lord Nicholas, who is called the pope and considers himself the emperor of the whole world, wanted to condemn us at the urging of those he supports in conspiracy, with Christ's favor, we resisted his madness in every way. He later regretted his actions.</s>
<s>We have sent you these chapters so that you may understand our complaint against the aforementioned pontiff.</s>
<s>However, after leaving Rome and traveling further away, we were again recalled to Rome.</s>
<s>As we began to return, we wrote you these letters so that you would not be surprised at our longer delays.</s>
<s>Frequently visit and comfort our lord king, both in person and through your envoys and letters.</s>
<s>Reconcile as many friends and faithful as you can to him, especially always invite King Louis, admonishing him, and diligently inquire with him about common interests, because our peace will be in the peace of those kings.</s>
<s>Be of calm mind and tranquil heart, dear brothers, for we hope to announce to you such things by God's will, in which you can perceive without error the Spirit of the Lord teaching you what and how you ought to act.</s>
<s>Above all, remind the aforementioned king to remain steadfast among various suggestions until he himself understands the causes of things.</s>
</speak>
chunks.original_latin:
Sanctis ac venerandis fratribus et coepiscopis
Guntharius atque Theotgaudus in Domino salutem. Rogamus suppliciter charissimam fraternitatem
vestram ut nobis pro vobis assidue orantibus sanctarum
 precum solatia instanter impendatis, et neturbemini
neque terreamini pro his, quae fama forte
de nobis ac vobis sinistrius nuntiat. Confidimus de
Domini nostri clementissima bonitate, quia neque
in regem nostrum neque in nos, opitulante Deo, inimicorum
praevalebunt insidiae, neque gaudebunt de
nobis adversarii nostri. Nam quamvis domnus Nicolaus
qui dicitur papa, et qui se apostolum inter apostolos
annumerat, totiusque mundi imperatorem se
facit, ad illorum instinctum et votum, quibus conspiratus
favere dignoscitur, nos damnare voluisset,
tamen modis omnibus Christo propitio suae insaniae
renitentes invenit, et quidquid inde fecit, non mediocriter
illum postmodum poenituit. Misimus vobis
haec subscripta capitula, quibus cognoscatis nostram
 adversus praefatum pontificem querimoniam. Nos
autem egressi a Roma longiusque recedentes, iterum
ad Romam revocati sumus. Quo nos incipientes
reverti, has vobis litterulas scripsimus, ut non miremini,
 quod longiores agimus moras. Dominum
regem nostrum tam per vos ipsos quam per vestros
missos et litteras saepius visitate et confortate, eique
quoscunque potestis amicos et fideles conciliate,
maxime Ludovicum regem admonendo semper invitate,
et cum illo de communi utilitate diligenter inquirite,
quoniam in pace eorum regum 
erit pax nostra. Aequo animo estote et tranquillo
corde, domini fratres, quia Deo volente talia vobis
nuntiare speramus, in quibus absque errore poteritis
advertere spiritum Domini docentem quid et
quomodo agere debeatis. Tantum omnimodis praefatum
regem commonere curate, ut inter varias suggestiones
ita maneat immobilis, donec et ipse rerum
causas cognoscat.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation: However, dear brothers, it is important and praiseworthy to keep your promised loyalty to our king unwavering before both God and men. May Almighty God bless and keep you in His holy service.
chunks.original_latin:
Caeterum, desiderantissimi
 fratres, necessarium vobis est et laude dignum, ut
promissam regi nostro fidem coram Deo et hominibus
inviolabiliter conservemus. Deus omnipotens
vos in suo sancto servitio conservare dignetur.
